ca.mcgill.ecse211.threads

Class UltrasonicPoller

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.threads.ThreadControl
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.threads.UltrasonicPoller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class UltrasonicPoller
extends ThreadControl
    This class implements the Ultrasonic Sensor Poller for our Wall Follower. Control of the wall follower is applied periodically by the UltrasonicPoller thread. The while loop at the bottom executes in a loop. Assuming that the us.fetchSample, and cont.processUSData methods operate in about 20mS, and that the thread sleeps for 50 mS at the end of each loop, then one cycle through the loop is approximately 70 mS. This corresponds to a sampling rate of 1/70mS or about 14 Hz.
    Author:
    Caspar Cedro, Percy Chen, Patrick Erath, Anssam Ghezala, Susan Matuszewski, Kamy Moussavi Kafi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UltrasonicPoller(SampleProvider us, float[] usData, SensorData cont)
      This constructor creates an instance of the UltrasonicPoller class to provide distance data from an ultrasonic sensor to our Wall Follower.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UltrasonicPoller

        public UltrasonicPoller(SampleProvider us,
                        float[] usData,
                        SensorData cont)
        This constructor creates an instance of the UltrasonicPoller class to provide distance data from an ultrasonic sensor to our Wall Follower.
        Parameters:
        us - a SampleProvider class instance that helps us to store an array of ultrasonic sensor data.
        usData - an array of distance data to be used by our Wall Follower's UltrasonicControllers.
        cont - a BangBangController or PController instance that has accumulated distance data stored in usData passed to it.
